item.title: A new millisecond pulsar in the globular cluster GLIMPSE-C01
item.description: Astronomers have discovered a new millisecond pulsar in the globular cluster GLIMPSE-C01. According to the research results published on the preprint server arXiv , this is the first such object in this cluster. A pulsar is a rotating neutron star with intense magnetic fields that emits symmetrical beams of narrow-directed electromagnetic radiation, similar to a lighthouse. The fastest rotating pulsars with rotation periods of less than 30 milliseconds are known as millisecond pulsars (MSP).
